dialogues.text: Push... That's it. The darkness slowly gives way to light as we reveal a sma style delivery room. SUPER TITLE: RHODE ISLAND 1969.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Mrs. Dunne you're doing great. There's the head... I can see it now... Congratulations, uhh, it's... gone back in. MRS. DUNNE is confused, as are the doctors and nurses. Th another attempt. The doctor reaches towards camera and we pull back into t Fade up on white letters: H A R R Y. A small baby hand RE turns the second "R" backwards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to need to push harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels like he's holding on. The doctor reaches in and pulls out a tiny foot. A tug-of between the baby foot and the large doctor hand, and it l baby's winning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a shy one here. The doctor reaches back in and pulls out another foot. Th their way out of the doctor's hand. DOCTOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's holding onto my lungsungs- ungs- ungs. We see her chest shaking. The doctor reaches in, yes - wa around. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little help. EXT. DUNNE HOUSE Гђ MOMENTS LATER A Police car pulls to a stop and the two patrolmen rush o EXT. DUNNE HOUSE BACKYARD Гђ DAY EIGHT YEAR OLD HARRY, standing over a old well in the bac Police approach as Harry pulls up the end of a rope. TEN-YEAR OLD HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Rob fell in the well! Help him! Captain Rob, can you hear me!? The Cops look anxiously down into the well bur see that i 'well' at all. OFFICER DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Harry we can't keep coming out here getting your... friend out of trouble. You see it's keeping us from chasing the real bad guys. TEN-YEAR OLD HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for saving Captain Rob. (hears O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay - wait for me! HARRY runs off, leaving the policeman a bit bewildered as MRS. DUNNE approaches. MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry David, He just gets a little mixed up sometimes. OFFICER DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's okay. Harry's a fine boy, overly active imagination is all. TEN-YEAR OLD HARRY O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay off the breaks, Captain Rob. PAN TO see Harry push an empty go-cart to the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY stands in the front yard looking around for Captain later Mrs. Dunne appears in the doorway holding a rolled HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true what you said to Captain Rob? MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Harry. I can't home school you anymore. So maybe it's time to make some new friends, some friends your own age... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not ready. Dejected, Harry starts back inside. Mrs. Dunne stops him. MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot. Captain Rob left this behind for you, he said count your steps very carefully. She hands him a rolled-up scroll. Harry brightens, his dr alive. He unrolls the scroll and we see his mother has dr map, with an "X" marking the school. HARRY (impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, a treasure map! What's the treasure? MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be anything. You're going to discover a whole new world when you get to school. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow just like Marco Polo. MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Mom, like in the pool. She acts like she gets it. They have a deep heart-felt hu MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be just fine, HARRY. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I am, Mom. MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your lunch. And an apple and banana for extra energy. HARRY (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the treasure's a chest full of apples and bananas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be. Sweet boy. She tries to comb Harry's hair, but the COMB GETS STUCK. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you know that never works. MRS. DUNNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. She pats down his hair with her hands. Harry puts the ban pants pocket and starts walking right. MRS. DUNNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other left. And now it's nine hundred sixty seven. Bye Harry! I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angle on LLOYD CHRISTMAS, getting his hair trimmed by his RAY (chokes up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior year. My little boy. Who woulda thunk it? (as he cuts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good kid, Lloyd. I don't say it enough, but I'm proud of you son. LLOYD (in the bowl, echoes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Pop. RAY pulls the bowl off his head and dusts him off. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's for not crying. RAY hands him a lollipop from the pile of chewed gum. RAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's gonna open soon. Go get cleaned up. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys, please. RAY throws him a huge ring of keys. Lloyd catches it and spin with them, like a ninja-locksmith. MUSIC/TITLES BEGIN (or) CONTINUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting a door that reads 'CUSTODIAN CLOSET', Lloyd dance fast paced rhythm. He walks past the gymnasium (and a sig "Boy's Showers").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD enters a door that reads, "Chemistry Lab".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A poster on the wall reads: 'Chemical Shower - For Use In Contamination only!' And a drawing of a man pulling a cha head. LLOYD still sings as he pulls the chain, which starts the brief fire extinguisher-like chemical shower. He pulls ag while soaping up. He shakes himself off, refreshed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOT on napkin dispenser, Lloyd's hand delicately p napkin out - the last one. Still singing, we reveal, LLOYD, his wet naked body plastered with hundreds of pape been using to dry himself. He walks off doing an impressi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD, still covered in napkins, presses a button and a m drying fan fires up. All the napkins fly off him, as Lloy stepping on a FLOOR-CREEPER which rolls quickly out of fr SFX: Crash Reveal Lloyd has landed in a spill-barrel of transmission

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHEMISTRY CLASS - MOMENTS LATER Once again Lloyd sho shakes himself off, refreshed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD walks out of the closet wearing an assortment of od RAY exits another classroom at the same time. RAY (full of pride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure are looking sharp there in your back to school outfit. RAY pulls out an old camera from lost and found. RAY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take your picture. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No can do. Gotta catch my bus. See ya, Pop!! We HOLD ON Ray as he watches Lloyd run off. RAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're already at school! (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go through this every year. He picks up and eats an old sandwich from the lost and fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD rushes out the school's front doors, going against people entering. Books and papers fly as he runs away fro LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my way! Can't miss my bus! Gotta get to school! Then he tears off down the street. Some students look bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, with his combed hair, is reading his map as he fin apple. HARRY (counting steps, eating his apple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven hundred thirty two... bite number six... Follow the map, find a friend - how does the apple work into this. (he stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is distracting. One of these has to go. He looks at the map, he looks at the apple, then the map, apple. HARRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope I'm making the right decision. He looks at the apple again. HARRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take your seeds and grow into a beautiful pie. He tosses the apple. It lands in a yard where it hits a MEAN LOOKING DOG in th dog looks up, growls when he sees Harry and begins the ch attack mode. HARRY hears the growling dog, turns and after a swallowed running. The dog's overly long chain unravels as he gains on Harry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lloyd running towards camera in the opposite direc LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must catch bus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Harry as the dog is about to bite his ass. Then very quickly we see the chain stop the dog in mid-ai just as Harry rounds the corner and SMASHES HEAD FIRST IN looks very painful as they both fall to the ground. LLOYD shakes it off and holds his mouth. Harry's once com now permanently disheveled. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody chipped my tooth. REVEAL his trademarked chipped tooth. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think I feel? Someone bit me in the forehead. REVEAL the piece of tooth is stuck in his forehead. Harry and tosses it away. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could've saved that for the tooth fairy! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's stupid! I happen to know my mom is the tooth fairy. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom is the tooth fairy? That is so cool! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she must do all the flying around when I'm asleep. (extends his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY Dunne. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, not hungry. Harry Dunne. Why does that name not sound familiar? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably because we've never met. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not it. Anyway - (extends his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD Christmas. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am bragging my Mom is the tooth fairy, and I'm talking to Santa's kid! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you around here before. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home school. Til today. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home school? What's that? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go to school where I live. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too! LLOYD sees his school bus pass. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, I missed it. Now I gotta walk. HARRY (hold up map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's just over there. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what I think it is? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a treasure map. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom says the treasure's somewhere in the school. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm pretty familiar with the school and I've never seen that "X". But... I do know something. HARRY (leans in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LLOYD (he tags him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. LLOYD takes off. HARRY (calls after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm "it"? What's "it"? LLOYD stops. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know. But whatever it is, it's something you don't want to be. And, right now, you are. He walks away. Harry catches up to him, and as they walk them tag back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the crowd. Harry is pleasantly overwhel attractive girls. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High school is all about looking cool. So stick with me. They see a group of CHEERLEADERS. HARRY (ga-ga)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Are those cheerleaders, just like on TV? LLOYD turns Harry away from the girls as if avoiding home LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, dangerous cult. Don't make eye contact or they might talk to you. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't we want them to talk to us? LLOYD (confidently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no no. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, besides cooties and other medical reasons, they're not in the cool crowd. Which I am, and you want to be. Know what I mean? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. HARRY turns and sees JESSICA, a beautiful seventeen-year- DRAMATIC MUSIC comes up, Harry is entirely in love. He sp very uncomfortable moments trying to remember how to brea HARRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a total dork. Just look how she dresses. LLOYD points to Jessica in her short, sexy skirt. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out her skirt, it's so short. I mean, where's the flood? He points at her tight shirt and ample cleavage. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And look at her shirt, it's not even buttoned right. Her milk bubbles are popping out! Loser! JESSICA drops something and picks it up. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I don't think she's even wearing underwear! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nerdy is that? I'm wearing two pairs right now. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too! LLOYD raises his hand to high five. Harry doesn't know wh and in self defense, punches Lloyd in the chest. LLOYD goes in to poke him in the eye. They are about to (playfully) get into it when, suddenly, bumped from behind, as we reveal TURK, a LOST BOYS type w TOUGH GUY HAIRCUT. He reaches up and GRABS LLOYD by the n LLOYD (choked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my Injun friend, Turk. He's part of the cool crowd. (to Turk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kimosabe! TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, ass face. LLOYD (proud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Iroquois name he's given me because I have the strong face of an ass. TURK drags Lloyd away. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya, Harry! Gotta have a little pow wow. HARRY is left alone for a moment. Looking down, he turns headfirst into JESSICA. JESSICA (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. HARRY (stumbling for something to say)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I hope the carpet matches the drapes. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. HARRY (points to her newspaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the new library there. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. I don't think they do. You're new here, right? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends how you define 'new'... JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the kid who was home schooled. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. How'd you know? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been assigned to write an article about you for the school paper. It was either a feature on you or the new four-color ink pens at the student store. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four colors? Neato! JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I'd much rather write an expose or a hard hitting investigative piece, but nothing really ever happens around here. But, I chose you and that's fine. (she extends her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jessica Matthews. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY Dunne. HARRY has never had a part of a girl so close to him so h in awe of her hand for a long beat. Finally Harry gathers to shake her hand and just as they're about to touch, Tur with Lloyd in tow. TURK (laughs to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, freak show, did Jessica give you that banana in your pants? HARRY does in fact have a banana in his front pocket. HARRY (looks down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, my Mom did. TURK (grimacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross! HARRY (pull's out his banana)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bite? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURK, leave him alone. TURK (mimicking Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURK, leave him alone. (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming too. He pushes Harry away from Jessica. LLOYD (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Turk rescued you from the nerd. You're in! JESSICA (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to you later. TURK leads Lloyd away with Harry. TURK (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have you been held back two years like Lloyd? HARRY (as if)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I've been held back three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS, the forty-something headmaster of this below average school, is there with the attractive, albei head lunch lady, MS. HELLER. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and, Principal Collins, you'll be pleased to know that this year Wednesdays are "South of the Border" days. We'll serve a spicy tuna tamale along with a cheese quesadilla. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Good. Good. Well, that's good. PRINCIPAL COLLINS gets up. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it sounds like it's going to be another hot year in the kitchen. They lunge at each other. They pull at each others clothe walls, fall to the floor and as Heller goes down. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I've missed you. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I you. More kissing. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. PRINCIPAL COLLINS V.O (passionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Oh yes. They hotly embrace and fall back behind the desk (Heller center drawer on the way down). There's a KNOCK ON THE DO FEMALE student, TALIA, enters and stands in the doorway, at the empty room. TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS? Hello? Still on his knees, he shoves Ms. Heller under the desk a the center drawer - this SLAMS INTO HELLER'S HEAD. PRINCIPAL COLLINS O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, what is it? Collins doesn't appear. TALIA (slightly confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh, Sir it's time for morning announcements. Collins POPS UP, still on his knees, looking a little dis glasses askew. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know dear. Well, why don't you do the announcements this morning. TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what do I announce? He pops back up. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You announce the most important news of the day. TALIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is? PRINCIPAL COLLINS (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make something up. She WALKS AWAY a bit confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins comes out from behind the desk. Heller follows, z dress. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know honey, I've finally figured out a way of bilking enough money from the school to get us that condo in Waikiki. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How baby-cakes? You've done it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small potatoes. This one is big time. This is visionary. This idea is genius. She nuzzles up to him. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the big potato. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's the big potato. Just have a look at this. He picks up a TATTERED GRANT BOOK. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Richard Moffit Special Needs Grant. Unbelievable. This kid was in a Special Needs program, learned how to string a couple of sentences together and now he's some successful hot shot. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you. INSERT: There's a PHOTOGRAPH OF A MAN over the LISTING. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, the state is giving a hundred thousand dollars in his name to every school that has a Special Needs class. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is fantastic. So all we have to do is kill this Moffit guy and we get all the money! PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. That's not it. We don't kill him. We don't kill anybody. But I like the way you're thinking. You're focused and you're trying to follow. No, what we need to do is start a fake Special Needs class. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start our own class? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe someday. Aloha cold weather, aloha hot weather. MS. HELLER looks confused. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said "aloha" twice. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aloha means hello and goodbye. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow. Look at you. They hug. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the problem is where do we find kids we can pass off as "special"? Out the window they see the back of Harry and Lloyd rise being hoisted up the flagpole by their underwear. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times two. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (sneaky)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll make a good teacher. MS. HELLER looks at him. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Collins puts his arm around her and strokes her head. Ms. at him, he's not quite sure if she gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd look down at the school crowd below. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Harry, this is my favorite time of day. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's nice. And your friend TURK is totally great. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's aces. (calling down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Turk! HARRY sees Jessica in the crowd below looking up at them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, she's beautiful. My wiener's all tingly. LLOYD (re: wedgie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shift to your left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER is addressing the class. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Special Needs orientation. I'm Ms. Heller, the lunch lady, er, I mean your new teacher. Reveal Harry and Lloyd, beaming with pride, are the only there, and the classroom is actually just a corner of the he talks Lloyd takes notes, Harry copies. MS. HELLER (CONT'D) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the reason you two are here before the class officially starts is because you're 'extra' special. And were personally selected by PRINCIPAL COLLINS. HARRY (to Lloyd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Principal Collins? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your assignment is to pick the class. Find some other students just as special as you. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will that be on the midterm? MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. LLOYD furiously erases all his notes, Harry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd, with a TRAY OF FOOD, walk along a bad 70 the PYRAMIDS OF EGYPT. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're the first person I've brought here. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is this your special place? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just usually eat my lunch on the crapper. Saves time. Out with the old, in with the new. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we eat there tomorrow? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Don't you have a phony class to teach? MS. HELLER O.S.

dialogues.text: LLOYD turns and writes as he's talking. LLOYD

dialogues.text: ... I'm Mr. Christmas and I've been assigned as your substitute teacher for today. I think you'll find me tough but fair. And, I imagine I'll learn as much.. from you.. as you will from.. me. He chuckles. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.text: First question. (turns to class)

dialogues.text: Yes, you. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: HARRY.
dialogues.text: LLOYD

dialogues.text: No. LLOYD

dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.text: Class, please study on your own. There seems to be a family emergency because there's no other reason why my father would interrupt me WHILE I'M WORKING! HARRY (impressed)

dialogues.text: We're not crazy. We're "special". PRINCIPAL COLLINS wants us to have our own classroom! RAY (proudly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Then I'm in. Just like Jerk-Off. CARL finally starts to shake off the effects of the concu CARL (still cloudy)

dialogues.text: A. Slushee. Don't tell me. (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. You're not gettin' me again. This goes on for awhile until, finally ending near the re Lloyd walks over to pay for the drinks. CALE CLARK, the CLERK, is a LONG-HAIRED METAL-HEAD wearin t-shirt. He looks up from a VICTORIA SECRET lingerie cata LLOYD (re: magazine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Fella. Victoria's Secret huh? Ya know those clothes are for chicks. CALE hits the register. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two fifty. HARRY approaches and tags Lloyd. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Ho! Okay. You wanna go? LLOYD tags Harry with purpose. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two fifty. They don't even notice him. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. LLOYD and Harry tag back and forth a half dozen times. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please pay me two fifty. LLOYD TAGS Cale. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. They both stare at him for a long beat. He doesn't move. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you are. He touched you. You're "it" until you touch someone else. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have five kids at home, I know how it works. I'm just not "it". Okay guys? Two fifty. LLOYD grabs the Cale's arm and makes it touch Harry. LLOYD (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. HARRY immediately tags the store employee back. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys. Give me the two fifty and go away. HARRY grabs his other arm and tags Lloyd with it. HARRY (to Lloyd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. LLOYD immediately tags the store employee back. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. Then Lloyd grabs the guy's arm and tags Harry. LLOYD (cont'd) (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it. This goes back and forth almost impossibly fast. Harry wi Lloyd with the other. They say, "You're it" with each tag are now flailing. He finally erupts. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!! He tags Lloyd. Hard. CALE (cont'd) (building anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it! CALE(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No touch backs, no do overs, no erasees, stamped to infinity plus one and THIS WHOLE STORE IS HOME

dialogues.speaker: FREE
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd look impressed. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he do that? LLOYD (staring at the clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, he can and he did. And now it's on like Donkey Kong. LLOYD and the Cale glare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BIG 'A' GAS N' STUFF
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd walk out of the store sipping their drink HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are really cold, huh? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you have to drink it fast, trust me. They both take huge fast sips. Our angle follows the icy liquid INTO THE STRAW and then stylized way) into Harry's brain to see BLOOD VESSELS STO brain get FROSTED OVER. Then PULL OUT from Harry's head to see a quick half-disso three-quarters of his brain with a layer of white frost. They both continue to get brain freezes as the scene goes don't realize it's from the drink. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww... refreshing. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow... What do you want to do,

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: LLOYD gets a brain freeze. Harry keeps slurping. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Owwww. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should go home and grade papers. Owwww. They sip harder. Their eyes twitch as the pain sears thro heads. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head is suddenly killing me. Maybe it's from all the learning today. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put some ice on it. He sips some more. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owww. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my mouph is frozen. JESSICA jogs over. She's wearing tight running shorts and bikini top. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heddo Jeth-ica. Because of the brain freeze, Harry and Lloyd both talk to slurred speech and drooling a little. Jessica talks to th like they're slow. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, I heard Collins has you in some kind of special class. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If dou're trying to get in, dou're doo late. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I know that class isn't for me. But I'm happy for you guys. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you thill want to do an arwticle on me, Jethica? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you and the whole Special Needs class. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ith dat newth? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This school's never had one before. I'd like to talk to you and all your special friends. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we go on a fee-eee-eee- wald twrip. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A field trip? Maybe I'll join you. See you tomorrow. She jogs off, her tight shorts and top bouncing as she go HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she goes, now wearing nothing but her underwear. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a nerd. I don't know where that girl's ever gonna find a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS and Ms. Heller are in his office. It's on in the building. Don Ho's "Tiny Bubbles" plays on a re Ms. Heller wears a coconut bra and a grass skirt. She doe Collins. He sips his tenth umbrella'd drink and snaps a P MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock knock. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there? MS. HELLER (modelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what"s under these coconuts. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a surprise. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I've got a little surprise for you. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the Extender? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I heard from Superintendent ZIMMER this morning and evidently he's so impressed with our Special Needs class, he's bringing Richard MOFFIT himself to the Thanksgiving Day parade- check in hand. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monkey, this is too exciting! I can't believe our dream is coming true. Collins picks up a POLAROID CAMERA. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smile sweetheart. He snaps a shot of Ms. Heller's chest. He waves it dry. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More pictures for the chest. He opens a chest by his desk and drops the photos into it MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you keep in there? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, things. Photos. Tapes. I tape everything that goes on in this office. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. Just for the record. He hits the stop button on small tape recorder in an open desk. He ejects the tape and puts it into the wooden ches MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just like the President. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like the President. Angle holds on the chest, which Collins has left unlocked

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BIG 'A' GAS N' STUFF
dialogues.text: LLOYD runs up and sees Harry, who's dressed like a QUEEN, tiara and flowing gown made from a drape. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD, where've you been? I've been waiting forever. I'm so embarrassed. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Why are you dressed like a Queen!? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cause you said... LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, I said don't 'dress like a Queen'! HARRY (getting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... that makes much more sense. I had a heck of time getting these drapes from my mom. You don't want to know where I put the cord. LLOYD (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY! Here he comes. We see Cale the clerk closing up the store. Lloyd and Har Cale turns and sees Lloyd the Ninja and Harry the Queen. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're out of the store, huh? CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're closed. So go away. HARRY (holding back the urprise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually we have something for you. LLOYD taps him lightly on the shoulder. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it! The Ninja and the Queen run away laughing maniacally. Cal confused and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA, carrying a camera, approaches Ms. Heller getting car. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER, mind if I tag along on your field trip? I'm thinking of doing a story on your special needs class. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested. Not after the smear story you did on my chicken sushi. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when 200 students are hospitalized with stomach cramps I think it's newsworthy. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, you could have mentioned the sauce. (noticing camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I see you have a camera. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So can I come along? MS. HELLER (grabs the camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. JESSICA notices something under Ms. Heller's shirt. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a coconut bra? MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're good. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you teaching Special Needs? You're the lunch lady. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dietician! This interview is over. You can have the camera back tomorrow. Come by the classroom. Heller heads off. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the lunch room? Heller stops and turns back to her. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well played. MS. HELLER storms away, leaving a confused Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD unrolls the map. Behind them there is a 'SLOW CHILD sign. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the map, we're just about at school. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we still haven't found any treasure. A long yellow school bus is parked in front of the school Chong and Carl stand next to the front door. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we may have found something even better. The bus now appears to be GETTING LONGER! Then we see tha actually a long bus PARKED BEHIND a SUPER-SHORT BUS. SFX: Majestic chorus. They look like they've seen the Holy Grail (if they knew was). LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Look! The short bus is even shorter than a regular short bus. I suited to the Special Needs class, as it only has three r Harry and Lloyd run up to it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our own special bus. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know it's for us? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh. The cool kids sit in the back of the bus. Here, every row is in the back. We're all cool! LLOYD and Harry run in. Lloyd runs as fast as he can down aisle, and smacks into the back of the bus. LLOYD (cont'd) (brings head up - giddy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's even shorter than I imagined! HARRY runs smack into the back of the bus. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It feels about right to me. LLOYD gets up and again runs into the back of the bus. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. I was right. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the parking lot, Jessica approaches the Special needs congregating outside the short bus. Over the following, w hear the thumping of Harry and Lloyd smash into the back JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURK, what are you doing here? TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Needs class. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being a jerk doesn't make you special. TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just jealous. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, Ching Chong, you're not a Special Needs kid. You're just a foreign exchange student. CHING CHONG (defiant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ride with my man. She hugs Turk and buries her face in his chest. TURK (to Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the greatest class ever, don't ruin it. They start to board the bus as Ms. Heller approaches. MS. HELLER (to Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to get lost. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Ms. Heller, there's something fishy here, and I don't think it's Friday's special. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know. Being that I'm just the teacher and all. MARGIE, the BUS DRIVER, a crotchety old matron in her ear passes Ms. Heller and boards the bus. MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever have one of those days when you just want to drive the bus into a wall and end it all? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone in. MS. HELLER follows her on and slams the door in Jessica's looks determined. She's found her story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER sits behind Margie as she starts the engine. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go Margie. The museum ain't going to teach itself. MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Museum huh, haven't been there since my husband left me. I love art. She throws it in gear and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the bus heads up the street, Jessica hops into her PAR WAGON, which is actually three or four feet LONGER than t JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a much bigger story than four color pens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls to a stop. On the corner is a NEBBISH GUY c tank. He waits - then Margie waves him to go across. Then horn, LOUD. He jumps - throwing the fish tank in the air. MARGIE (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fun stuff. She drives on - BURNING RUBBER! We see that Jessica is fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER looks out the back window and sees Jessica fol station wagon. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a scoop, huh? I'll give you a scoop... of short bus. (to Margie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose her! MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loser... oh yeah he was a loser alright. A big loser. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a big loser! What are you deaf!? MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no and I don't appreciate...turn down here! MARGIE yanks the wheel, making a sharp turn to the left. as it passes. And pick it up further down the street. Our inside a RECORD STORE as we see the bus make a hard right followed by Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus careens down the street followed by Jessica's sta Jessica is almost along side them. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let her pass! Heller leans forward and hits the 'NO PASSING' TOGGLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIDE OF THE BUS as the big 'No Passing' SIGN FLIPS OUT, c Jessica's windshield. She almost HITS IT then slows.  MARGIE O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it started with a pass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."hi cutie, nice knockers", then same old same old. MS. HELLER (to Margie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, now make a left, then straight! MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah he was straight all right, just wasn't very good in the sack. I used to give him directions. Higher, lower, faster, harder, small circles, do the alphabet. Useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAR OF THE BUS, red lights flash, sign reads: 'No Passin Lights Flash'. The road narrows so Jessica must again fal behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MS. HELLER sees a street up ahead. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left here! Left! MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet I left him, took the dog and we was history. MS. HELLER sees a tiny alley between two buildings. They power-sliding down an alley, Jessica misses the turn and eighty. MS. HELLER (looking behind them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Too big to make the turn! MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it actually fit quite nicely. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, except for the fact that it wasn't really as long as it was wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do a rough turn and exit the alley. Ms. Heller looks Jessica. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you did it. MARGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right I did it. Went back and set the house on fire, his little floozy testified in court - and I ended up doing ten years at Rikers, got my teeth knocked out by Mike the Dyke. MS. HELLER (now paying attention)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about? ANGLE ON: Lloyd, Harry and Carl. Once again, Carl is star better, he notices his surroundings. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm not supposed to be on the short bus. I've got a Calculus class. LLOYD (to Harry, whimsical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a dreamer. CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually I think I'm all better. ANGLE ON: Heller. IN THE MIRROR, she sees Jessica pull up MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn here! Go, go, go! And she SLAMS her foot on Margie's gas pedal, as Margie m through a DIRT CONSTRUCTION SITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lot, the bus leaves a trail of dust as Jessica's c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A serene moment before a far away scream is heard, then t CRASHES THROUGH A FENCE, fully launched in the air! While in the air, our angle FLOWS INTO the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In ULTRA-SLOW MOTION, it's ZERO GRAVITY as we TRACK throu see: MARGIE'S UNFAZED, but her dentures FLOAT OUT OF HER MOUTH frozen in a scream, legs in the air. As CARL floats past past LEWIS, CHING CHONG and TURK who are in a jumble of a CARL continues on to HARRY and LLOYD who act as if they a 13, tongue's out both chasing the same FREEZE-DRIED ICE C together almost for a KISS, then grossed out, break apart from their lunch bags is floating around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We BURST OUT of the bus as it LANDS ROUGHLY ON THE STREET CARL hard against the back window, followed by a mess of and Margie's dentures that get slammed against the window sandwiched by half of a peanut butter sandwich. The Short on. HARRY (O.S.) (re: bus ride)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, again! Everyone shouts "Again!".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lands even more roughly, and must LOCK UP HER BRAKES backs into her path. Beyond the truck she sees the Short away. She's defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the bus on the street outside the glass doors. MS. HELLER (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. The kids file inside. They are disheveled, covered in foo tripping, Carl's back to his old, cloudy way - you get th TWO PASSERSBY, a MAN and a WOMAN, notice the motley crew. MAN (sympathetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special needs. WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, aren't they just so sweet. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone find a partner. You're not any good to me dead. The class ad-libs partnering up: Turk with Ching Chong, T Terri, Lewis with Carl. Harry and Lloyd look around nervo partner. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Captain Rob's always been my partner. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks for you. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your partner? LLOYD (looks around at the obviously partnered class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I haven't decided yet. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Uh...maybe... jeez, how can I say this... you and I could...perhaps ...maybe...uh... partner up? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me? Dream on, desperado. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. You're right, field trip partner is a big commitment. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding! Of course I'll be your partner. LLOYD puts his arm around Harry and they head into the mu LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some serious self-worth issues, my ugly, stupid, pudgy little friend. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, you're embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a giant white polar bear in menacing pose, arms bared. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to be a polar bear. Tall, strong, six stomachs. He's the most beautiful creature in the forest. REVEAL Harry and Lloyd looking up at the polar bear. Harr LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a cow, Harry. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could go for a tall glass of polar bear milk right now. MS. HELLER ENTERS and corrals Harry, Lloyd, and the rest Needs class. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, class, everyone gather round. Mr. Collins wants a picture to prove you were here. (catching herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to cherish. She unfurls a banner, and hands it to Turk and Ching Chon reads "SPECIAL NEEDS CLASS FIELD TRIP 1986". She spots a nearby MUSEUM DOCENT. MS. HELLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Do you mind? She hands her camera to the Docent who snaps their photo. MS. HELLER (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, got it. (to docent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long is the average field trip here? DOCENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fully experience all we have to offer? Maybe two hours. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. I'll be back in four. Give them the tour twice and talk slowly. She puts the camera away and walks off. DOCENT (to class)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, listen up everybody. Welcome to the Shea Museum of Natural History. Where your journey into the past comes alive! She turns and faces the polar bear. DOCENT (cont'd) (bad acting polar bear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grrr. Roar. Grrr. My name is Ursus Maritmus and I live in parts of Northern Canada and the Antarctic. Grr. Roar. Grr. I rely on a keen sense of a smell to sniff out prey. My long neck helps me view my habitat and pluck fish from the sea. Roar. Glub glub. Roar. She turns back around in a menacing polar bear pose and s gone except for Harry and Lloyd. DOCENT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh scared them away. Too many "Roars." The young boy raises his hand. YOUNG BOY (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? DOCENT (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, Ursus Maritimus. LLOYD (to boy with authority)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a real name. His parents called him "Snowy". YOUNG BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name? He points to a Snow Fox. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also Snowy. YOUNG BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Now it makes total sense why she didn't want him to know we were in his office the other night. Collins starts up the car. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.text: Don't let him see us. HARRY and Lloyd run over to the gas pumps and try to hide nonchalant. Over the following, Harry pumps gas into a side window of Lloyd actually sprays gas all over the windshield. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder we both struck out with her. Who can compete with the sexual power of the man who occupies the highest office in the land? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's like the Pope. Like we're gonna snake a girl away from the Pope. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's go spy on them. Collins backs out of the gas station. Harry and Lloyd put back. Lloyd jumps in a shopping cart and Harry starts pus comes out of the store, takes a drag of his cigarette and car (the car Harry and Lloyd gassed up and in).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd have wheeled after Collins, when a huge e erupts. The gas pumps are now a ball of fire. HARRY and Lloyd stop, look back and stare. From above, Ca frame, landing right in front of them. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, are you alright? CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think. LLOYD leans down and pokes him. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're it! (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Harry, let's go. CALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! That's my shopping cart! The boys race off in the cart, down the street, following

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are oblivious to the explosion behind them. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you say to my parents on the phone? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to expect you tonight. Through the rear window WE SEE Harry and Lloyd roll up in crouch down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd grab on to the rear bumper of the car and Collins drives on.

dialogues.speaker: EXT CITY STREET
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd riding Collins' car through the streets. into the street and almost crash head-on into a FIRE TRUC DALMATION riding on top. They turn back and watch it go a HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute puppy. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be on his way to pee out a fire. Up ahead, they see a 'MR. SOFTEE' ICE CREAM TRUCK with a on top. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look. Ice cream. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thinking what I'm thinking? As Collins' car stops for a red light, the boys race thro intersection and grab a hold of the ice cream truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see that the DRIVER has no idea what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are at the side window of the ice cream truck, n holding ice cream cones. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Harry, want dessert! They SPLIT OFF from the ice cream truck. CUT TO: INT./EXT. COLEY DOG - HOT DOG CAR - CONTINUOUS TIGHT ON t ship's Captain then BOOM OUT to see it's actually a Hot D Boy's are at the back eating dogs that are covered in ket mustard. Happy as can be they all motor off down the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to ask you one last time and if I don't get an answer, I don't even want to think about the consequences which would be frightening to say the least. Where's my chest, Jessica? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Collins empties out Jessica's backpack. He holds up a tap PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what have we here? It appears be a tape. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not your tape. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where did you get this not my tape. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: THAT'S NOT YOUR TAPE.
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play with me dear, you're way out of your league. Collins exits with the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd road weary and wind blown, approach the h peek in a window and see the back of Jessica's head. She' room. Harry taps on the window. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: JESSICA
dialogues.text: JESSICA turns, sees Harry and Lloyd outside the window. T - covered in ice cream, ketchup and mustard. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY! Lloyd! You guys are a mess. LLOYD (debonair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the best man won. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us your boyfriend was Principal Collins? JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! Look. She holds up her hand which is handcuffed to the table. HARRY/LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinky! Suddenly they hear the sound of Lloyd's mix tape. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my mix tape! You're using it for your seduction? I'm flattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins is at a tape recorder, looking very confused at L singing. He presses fast forward and is annoyed when all Lloyd's rambling. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... If I may quote the twentieth century poet (mispronounces 'Piscopo')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Joe Piscahpo: (Like Billy Crystal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look Marvelous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD, when we were in Principal Collins's office, did you see any kind of chest? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY's treasure chest? Sure. I know where that is. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found my treasure? Why didn't you tell me. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three words. I did. But you were all mad at me and wouldn't listen. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm listening now. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. This is my favorite part of the tape. LLOYD bops along as he listens to his mix tape. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, Lloyd, listen to me. I only have time to say this once. Collins is a criminal. He's kidnapped me. The evidence you need to convict him is in that chest. You've got to take what's in that chest and make sure people know about it before the parade tomorrow and Collins and Heller get their money and leave town... The boys hear none of this. We hear their thoughts as the wander. LLOYD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God she's cute. Look at her teeth. I bet she could bite through anything. Yes, yes she could. JESSICA sees Lloyd nodding like he's paying attention. Sh Harry, who's also nodding. HARRY (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder what Lloyd's thinking about? (Harry glances over at LLOYD, then back at JESSICA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all that hair. She must have millions of tiny holes in her head. Otherwise it would just bunch all up on her brain... JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So guys, you listening to me? HARRY/LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah./ Sure. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, before the parade. HARRY/LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right. The parade. Just then Ms. Heller ENTERS in the background with some S HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, it's our teacher. JESSICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, she's in on it too. Don't let her see you. Just go get that chest and show the world what Collins has been doing. I'm staying here. LLOYD (lewdly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously. MS. HELLER (calls out to Jessica)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So miss snoopy reporter girl, it appears that you've snooped yourself into a corner and snoopcuffed yourself to a desk. Whose wearing the Coconut bra now? JESSICA just stares at her. MRS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I just have one word for you. Aloha. The one that means goodbye! With confidence, Heller heads off down the hallway. JESSICA (to Harry and Lloyd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about me, I'll be fine. I can take care of myself and I'm getting the story every high school reporter dreams of. LLOYD (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My dream date with Principal Collins." HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was the one writing that story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON the lock as Lloyd is about to break it. Harry st HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Lloyd, the real treasure is our friendship. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How true. But I still feel I deserve more than you do of this treasure. I mean, I found it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my mom gave me the map. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lugged it all over town! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made the polar bear pants. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ate your Mom's pie. HARRY (struggling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... found that rock. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a diamond and you swallowed it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were all out of top hats. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Look what this cursed chest is doing to us. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who we are anymore. TIGHT ON the trunk. Lloyd breaks the lock. They open the SWELLS. WE SEE a shot of Collins' incriminating files, ph HARRY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea - it's full of files and documents and tapes. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what this means? HARRY/LLOYD (ecstatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rich! They take the chest contents and throw it like gold coins LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy, we hit the jackpot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY and Lloyd rolling around in the papers and rubbing their bodies. Harry picks up a casette tape. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lloyd. This looks like another one of your mix tapes. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the pirate who buried this treasure chest made it. Put it on. HARRY sticks the tape in a player. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Principal's log, September twenty third. Check, check, sound check, check. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Principal Collins. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes total sense. The treasure chest was in his office. Which means Principal Collins is a pirate! I'm surprised Captain Rob never mentioned him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because Captain Rob is not a pirate. We've been through this. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing, testing, one two three... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, his mix tape really isn't as good as yours, Lloyd. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check, check, check, check... HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although he speaks pretty good Chinese. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Chinese. LLOYD fast forwards the tape. We hear FAST FORWARD NOISE. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Chinese. LLOYD presses play again. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Find idiots for phony Special Needs class, take the Moffit grant money and deposit it in an illegal personal account... LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, I don't get it. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it Jessica wanted us to do with this chest again? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about showing the world what Principal Collins has done. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. She's so proud of her boyfriend. LLOYD fast forwards a little more. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And that is how I, Principal Collins, became the mastermind behind this glorious plan. And the Special Needs brats don't know anything about it. It's the crime of the century. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right. We have committed the crime of the century. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What did we do? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never thanked him for giving us our Special Needs class. HARRY (eureka!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Jessica was talking about! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants us to show the world what a great guy Principal Collins is. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And like she said, do it before the parade. LLOYD sees the poor chalk drawing of a float on the black Heller left. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A float! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Build him a float for the Thanksgiving Day parade! LLOYD starts's modifying the float-sketch - it's scribble LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, we found the real thing to be thankful for. Screw George Washington! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Screw George Washington. Just like Marilyn Monroe did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open to REVEAL we're inside the darkened room a door slides open revealing Harry and Lloyd, hands on hips work. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready Lloyd? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a fork in me Harry, lets get started. LLOYD hits the lights to REVEAL the float of George Washi the Special Needs class. Lloyd picks up a sledgehammer. LLOYD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye, George Washington, hello PRINCIPAL COLLINS. HARRY stops him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! Have you ever noticed Principal Collins looks a little like George Washington? HARRY holds us a photo of Collins. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think he looks a lot like George Washington. LLOYD starts to swing his hammer. Harry stops him. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY, are we gonna build this thing or not? HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LLOYD, what I'm saying is we may already have what we want. LLOYD takes a long look at Collins' photo, then at Washin He smiles at Harry. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I get it now. Once again he raises his hammer to take another swing, an restrains him, the two share an awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start CLOSE ON a small aquarium that has been all tape (from the bus chase), the NEBBISH GUY stands nearby as we a MIDWAY CARNIVAL to see the High School's Thanksgiving D in progress. The bleachers are full of students and towns watching. Cheerleaders carry a banner reading, "PROVIDENC SCHOOL THANKSGIVING 1986".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS is nervously watching. Heller approache down next to him. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the chest is still out there somewhere. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. So as soon as Zimmer shows up, we'll get our check and blow this pop stand before anyone finds out anything. MS. HELLER (looking at parade)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This band sounds terrible. We see the marching band playing instruments that are old home made. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sold all the wind instruments. (holds up tickets)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawaiian Air, business class. And you like that new fur coat? MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love it! PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well there's a reason why that mascot isn't a stallion anymore. In front of a MARCHING BAND is a boy leading a goat, hold reading "GO STALLIONS!" MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horse? PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no it's not horse, you see I sold the horse. Behind the boy, Ray is driving a Cadillac convertible, wa crowd. A sign on the car reads "Custodian of the Year". A READS: 'Buy Original Ray's WAX - made from real ketchup a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR THE MARCHING BAND in the distance, as the Special students, Toby, Terri, Carl, Turk, Ching Chong and LEWIS in disbelief. TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you morons do? Where's George Washington? TERRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why'd you give him a makeover? REVEAL Harry and Lloyd putting the finishing touches on t They've RE-SCULPTED "Washington crossing the Delaware" in Collins the Pirate". With his statue now on a PIRATE SHIP This is all made from found objects that were in the Spec class and tractor shed. The statue's glasses are made fro George Washington's white hair is now black and he has bu eyebrows matching Collins. Just then Lewis enters wearing old horse mascot uniform and carrying the head. Half his close and tattered. LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late but I woke up tied to the bed and... He see's Washington/Collins eyebrows. LEWIS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - that's my hair! Someone cut it while I slept! HARRY and Lloyd 'act casual' whistle and look around. The closer in towards the float and we see: Washington's/Coll outstretched hand has been replaced with a pirate's hook the heating duct. There's a large sign that reads, "PRINC and the original treasure chest is now prominently displa the float. The whole thing is attached to Lloyd's waxer w Harry and Lloyd walk to the side of the boat HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, this is much better. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS is a greater American than George Washington will ever be. TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Why'd you make him a pirate? CHING CHONG (O.S.) (breaks the silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you why! Reveal Ching Chong at the treasure chest looking through first time Ching Chong speaks in a perfect American Accen CHING CHONG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't believe these documents. They provide evidence of a long history of fraud and embezzlement from the school by Principal Collins and Ms. Heller, a.k.a. the Lunch Lady. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Can you believe your ears? LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! No more clicks and whistles! Now she speaks perfect English! HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a great teacher, Lloyd. TURK approaches Ching Chong. TURK (saddened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHING CHONG, What happened to your beautiful Asian accent? CHING CHONG (no accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, my name is Cindy, the accent just helps me meet boys. She notices Turk's sad face. CHING CHONG (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it back - you got it Joe! TURK brightens and hugs her as they join the others who a examining the documents. TOBY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got state money for a ski club? We never had a ski club. TERRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins took two thousand dollars that was supposed to go to a new state of the art stallion mascot uniform. LEWIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw that. Why have I been wearing this one with puke in the head? TURK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta tell people about Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small GROUP of students rush by as Police Detective Mof Gould) gets out of his UNMARKED POLICE CAR. School Superi ZIMMER APPROACHES. ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if I can do this. MOFFIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you can. We gotta nail this guy. You'll be fine. ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collins can be a pretty crafty guy, what do I do if he smells the trap. MOFFIT (as he hides his badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he'll smell anything - just make sure he takes the check. I've been through this a hundred times. ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you know Detective, he's expecting (fingers in quotes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Moffit' to be someone who has... certain... well... MOFFIT (interrupts him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I get it. Don't worry I studied acting at the police academy just let me do the talking and you'll be fine. ZIMMER walks off and is followed by Moffit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERINTENDENT ROGER ZIMMER approaches Principal Collins. SUPERINTENDANT ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: PRINCIPAL COLLINS.
dialogues.text: PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Superintendent Zimmer, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPERINTENDANT ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to introduce you to Richard Moffit - former Special Needs student and now American success story. He gestures to MR. MOFFIT, who is mid 30's. Collins notic only wearing one shoe, the other foot is bare. PRINCIPAL COLLINS (to Zimmer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems Mr. Moffit has forgotten his shoe. SUPERINTENDANT ZIMMER (shrugs, then quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do. At least today he remembered his pants. (then, to Moffit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, this is Principal Collins. PRINCIPAL COLLINS takes Moffit's hand and shakes it - doe Collins sees a folded paper in his pocket (check?). PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Moffit, it's a great pleasure to meet you sir. And is that what I think it is...? MOFFIT pulls the paper out of his pocket, it is a CHILD L AN AIRPLANE. MOFFIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I drew this. Collins looks at Zimmer. Zimmer puts hands in air as 'quo ZIMMER (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Needs. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to present to the grant check today. MOFFIT (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am strong! ZIMMER (to Moffit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are. (to Collins) ZIMMER(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Mr. Moffit is looking forward to seeing the float from your Special Needs class first. He pats an envelope in his breast pocket. Principal Colli the envelope. MOFFIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can turn on all the faucets in my house. (close to Collins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the hose. ZIMMER (to Moffit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we don't drink from the house do we. Collins reacts uncomfortably to all this... ANGLE ON a few other floats and a band pass. CLOSE-ON MARGIE the bus driver. MARGIE (leaning out window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it will ya! C'mon I got better things to do. REVEAL she's driving the SPECIAL NEEDS BUS that is now PU SPECIAL NEEDS FLOAT - with the ENTIRE CLASS riding it. Sh the band ahead of her. MS. HELLER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here it comes. You're gonna love what the children have done. CLOSE ON Harry and Lloyd on the float. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start the tape, Lloyd. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that, Wilco. HARRY grabs two rods which are attached to the Collins fl operates the mouth. Lloyd hits a tape recorder button and voice comes booming out of speakers. PRINCIPAL COLLINS VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found a way to bilk enough money from the school to put us over the top. ANGLE ON: Principal Collins and the others in the bleache MOFFIT (pulls his jacket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like you! PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. They got the chest! SUPERINTENDANT ZIMMER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a float of you, Collins? Why are you a pirate? BACK TO FLOAT where we continue to hear Collins' voice bl speakers that ARE ATTACHED TO THE FLOAT. PRINCIPAL COLLINS VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've done it all. Trilingual education... twelve hundred dollars for fake mock government... twelve hundred charging tuition... Just then police cars zoom up and screech to a halt. TWO OFFICERS jump out with Jessica. HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. There's Jessica. LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could she miss this? This whole salute to Collins was her idea. ANGLE ON bleachers again. PRINCIPAL COLLINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what those kids are doing. Nothing they do makes any sense. That's why we started the Special Needs class. (sees police)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why we need that check! Collins grabs the check... ANGLE ON The float. Harry and Lloyd see Collins running a HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there goes Principal Collins! LLOYD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so modest. Probably embarrassed by all the attention. HARRY
